intro: Ekebergia capensis, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. The tree has pinnate leaves and produces legume pods that contain small, dark seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display and ability to thrive in various soil types. The plant also plays a role in supporting local biodiversity by providing food and habitat for various insects and birds.
